segments.text: I can’t believe how much water is pouring out of that sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like a waterfall in there, and the woman is just standing in it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress is probably getting soaked, but she doesn’t seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is turning into a lake, and it’s only going to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the drain is clogged or if she just forgot to turn off the faucet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are too busy with their cookies to notice the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like shouting at her to turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But she’s so focused on that plate, like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’m amazed at how oblivious she is to everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is going to end badly, and I can’t look away.
segments.speaker: PAR
